jobDescription:
We are BAD Spiele Studio, an independent American-German game development studio based in Berlin, founded by experienced indie developers. 

Our mission is to push the boundaries of game design by creating captivating and immersive experiences.

Our dedicated and passionate team thrives on the dark romanticism that defines our titles.
Currently, we are a close-knit team of 10, and we are looking to grow as we continue to build innovative and unforgettable gaming experiences.

We are looking for a skilled Pixel Artist/Animator to join our team. In this role, you will create and animate pixel art for characters, environments, and effects, contributing to the unique visual identity of our games. You’ll work closely with the CEO and Art Director to ensure your work fits within the established aesthetic and style of our projects. If you have a passion for pixel art and love bringing characters and worlds to life through animation, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who thrives in a collaborative, creative environment, where your contributions will directly shape the final product.

Location: Berlin preferred, but remote within Germany or Europe is acceptable for highly talented candidates.

Type: Full-time, 2-month work trial with permanent contract continuation.
requirements:
Proficient in pixel art creation and animation (experience with Aseprite or similar software is a plus).
Strong portfolio showcasing pixel art and animations.
Ability to convert concept art into pixel art and create tilesets, character animations, and effects.
No specific degree is required, portfolio quality is key.
responsibilities:
Create pixel art for characters and environments, from low-res to high-res styles.
Animate pixel art, including character movements, attack animations, and environmental effects.
Work closely with the CEO/Art Director to develop and refine pixel art for various games.
benefits:
Free gym, sauna, lunch, discounted food and drinks, mental health recreation fund (€300/month), flat hierarchy, and direct access to the CEO and Art Director. You will be an integral part of a small but highly ambitious team, where your contributions will have a direct impact on the product's development, allowing you to see the tangible results of your work.
